item.title: FAMOUS CHAT BOT NAME LIST
item.description: Siri - Apple’s virtual assistant for iOS devices Alexa - Amazon’s virtual assistant for Echo devices Cortana - Microsoft’s virtual assistant for Windows devices Google Assistant - Google’s virtual assistant for Android devices and Google Home Mitsuku - an award-winning chatbot that can hold intelligent conversations Xiaoice - a popular chatbot developed by Microsoft for Chinese speakers Replika - an AI companion chatbot designed to help users improve their mental health

item.title: HISTORY OF CHAT BOTS
item.description: The history of chatbots dates back to the mid-20th century. In 1950, computer scientist Alan Turing proposed a test to determine whether a machine could demonstrate intelligent behavior that was indistinguishable from that of a human. The test became known as the Turing test, and it inspired early research into the development of chatbots. The first chatbot, called ELIZA, was created in the 1960s by MIT computer scientist Joseph Weizenbaum. ELIZA was designed to simulate a psychotherapist and could hold rudimentary conversations with users.
